intro: Waltheria rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaved waltheria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its round, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Waltheria rotundifolia is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
